page.title: 07CHILDREN'S GAMES
page.content: On the 16th July 1985, we asked 9,10 and 11 year old children at Mullion Primary School what games they like to play in their own time in the playground during breaks and lunchtime. Some of these are: 40-40; What's the time Mr.Wolf;Football; Rain,snow,thunder,lightning;British bulldog;Cat and mouse;Red rover; Kisschase;Sevensies. In order to pick sides for a team game or to establish who is "it" for a chasing game, the following rhymes are used:(At each word a person is pointed at in turn; the person pointed at for the last word is "it".) "Ip dip dogshit,Who stepped in it." "Ibble bobble,Black bobble,Ibble bobble_out." "Racing car number 9,Losing gallons all the time,How many gallons did he lose?".{The rules of one game is {explained on page 8.}
